Margaret Lanterman

Known as the Log Lady

Peak moments of Margaret Lanterman's life:

  • October 10, 1940 - Born in Twin Peaks, Washington
  • September 8, 1947 - Margaret and two other classmates, Carl Rodd and Alan Traherne, disappeared suddenly from a class field trip.
  • September 8, 1947 - Margaret, Carl, and Alan reappear from their vanishing the day prior with a pattern of three triangles on their knee.
  • February 18, 1989 - Margaret encounters Laura Palmer outside the local roadhouse and puts her hand on Laura's head while holding her log. She goes on to tell Laura:

    "When this kind of fire starts, it is very hard to put out. The tender boughs of innocence burn first, and the wind rises, and then all goodness is in jeopardy."

    -- Margaret Lanterman, 1986
  • October 1, 2016 - Died from lung cancer in Twin Peaks, Washington

"This is 'now,' and now will never be again.... We come from the elemental, and return to it. There is change, but nothing is lost. There is much we cannot see – air, for instance, most of the time – but knowing our next breath will follow our last without fail is an act of faith. Is it not? Dark times will always come, as night follows day. A dark age will test us all, each and every one. Trust and do not tremble in the face of the unknown. It shall not remain unknown to you for long. Robert knows this now, as will we all in the sweet by-and-by."

-- Margaret Lanterman, 1986

If you have time and your interests are Peaked, visit this cult classic characters Fandom page.
